We create world-class content, which we distribute across our portfolio of film, television, and streaming, and bring to life through our theme parks and consumer experiences. We own and operate leading entertainment and news brands, including NBC, NBC News, MSNBC, CNBC, NBC Sports, Telemundo, NBC Local Stations, Bravo, USA Network, and Peacock, our premium ad-supported streaming service. We produce and distribute premier filmed entertainment and programming through Universal Filmed Entertainment Group and Universal Studio Group, and have world-renowned theme parks and attractions through Universal Destinations & Experiences.

Go behind the scenes with NBCUniversal's interns during their summer program! This summer, our interns have had the chance to learn from top professionals and create lasting memories. Hear directly from them as they share what their time at NBCUniversal has meant for their personal and professional growth. Read more about their experiences: https://bit.ly/4dSoEfo #InternAtNBCU #SummerInternship #NBCUHereYouCan

Inspired by the biggest names in horror, a chilling new collection of horrifying experiences await guests at Universal Studios' Halloween Horror Nights. This fall, guests will have the opportunity to brave new frights and nightmare-inducing experiences inspired by horror fan-favorites at Halloween Horror Nights – consistently named the world’s premier Halloween event. Halloween Horror Nights takes place on select nights at Universal Orlando Resort starting Friday, August 30 and at Universal Studios Hollywood Thursday, September 5. More on Halloween Horror Nights here: https://lnkd.in/dVcbTsYX #UniversalStudios #Halloween #NBCUniversal

NBCUniversal’s coverage of the Paris 2024 Paralympic Games will be accessible to more viewers of all abilities than ever before, delivering the excitement of the Paralympics with enhanced closed captioning, expanded audio description, and improved digital content accessibility. "For over a decade, Comcast NBCUniversal has been working to address barriers to make our experiences more inclusive. As a consumer of Paralympics programming with audio description, I’m looking forward to fully participating in the joy that the Paris 2024 Paralympic Games will bring." - Thomas Wlodkowski, Vice President, Accessibility at Comcast Read more: https://lnkd.in/dztiMKiV #Accessibility #Comcast #Paralympics

The wait is over! Tune in today to watch the Opening Ceremony of the #ParisParalympics! Meet Evan, a Broadcast Manager for the Paralympics afternoon cable show that will air on USA and CNBC Evan will be behind the scenes, organizing and overseeing a 40-person crew, ensuring the production goes smoothly. Hear as he “tells more” about being a part of the team at the Stamford, Connecticut office bringing together the Paralympics as they go for GOLD! #NBCOlympics #NBCUHereYouCan #ParisParalympics

Comcast NBCUniversal is on the #100CompaniesCare list by Great Place To Work US and PEOPLE Magazine | PEOPLE.com! This honor highlights companies that go above and beyond for their employees, communities and the environment. We’re thankful for our incredible colleagues who help make the world a better place every day. To learn more, visit https://bit.ly/3yYBPMV #NBCUHereYouCan #GreatPlaceToWork

Meet Noah, one of the Olympic hospitality guides who worked onsite in Paris throughout the games! From escorting guests to various sites across Paris, to seeing Team USA bring home gold at the Eiffel Tower Stadium, it's safe to say that the NBCUniversal hospitality interns had the experience of a lifetime at the #ParisOlympics! #InternatNBCU #NBCUniversal #Olympics

Who doesn't love a good competition? Inspired by the Paris Olympics and Paralympics, our colleagues teamed up to compete in the NBCUnites Summer Service Games. Sixty-two teams completed over 400 acts of service across the US and UK ranging from volunteer events to donations to local charities. Thanks to everyone who joined in! Visit https://lnkd.in/gYNfRQd to learn more about social impact at NBCU. #NBCUHereYouCan #NBCUnites #GivingBack #Volunteering #SocialImpact

“We wanted to get some of those smaller, more grassroots organizations that don't normally get the big funds, said Hilary Smith, NBCUniversal’s executive vice president for corporate social responsibility. “We hope that we’re giving grants that are providing building blocks for programs that are here to stay for the long term." Read more about the 2024 Local Impact Grant recipients: https://lnkd.in/eZxj-Jw9 #CSR #Impact #Nonprofits

In a city as iconic as Paris, especially during the 2024 Summer Olympics, prime studio space is in high demand. While Telemundo Deportes kicked off its coverage from a shared rooftop studio with NBC News during the Games’ opening weekend, the network soon transitioned to a more groundbreaking solution. After the initial on-site broadcasts, the rest of the programming originated from Studio L at Telemundo Center in Miami. By utilizing a state-of-the-art virtual set, Telemundo Deportes seamlessly transported viewers to the heart of Paris, recreating the city’s charm and iconic landmarks in an immersive experience. “I couldn’t imagine what this was going to be when our team started working on it,” says Manashi Mukherjee, VP of Technical Production at NBCUniversal Telemundo Enterprises. “The final product has exceeded everything that I could have imagined. It has been a labor of love, but our team enjoys innovating and being creative.” Read more: https://lnkd.in/eAczHq_y #Telemundo #Olympics #Production
